poem:
**1992**

Singapore's streets,
unclogged by gum—
a nation's resolve in each
clean sweep, each tongue-tied
reflection of vanished
elastics. No bubble-born
graffiti, no underfoot
ripple in the civic
fabric. Just a mirror
polished by prohibition's
hand, and a promise,
chewed over, swallowed,
to stick to less adhesive
resolutions.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Which country banned the sale of chewing gum in 1992? The Saturday quiz The questions 1 Which newspaper was launched in 1903 as “a reflection of women’s interests”?2 Which country banned the sale of chewing gum in 1992?3 The Cotswolds is the biggest of 46 what?4 What so-called miracle drug is made by Novo Nordisk?5 Which historian founded Ukip?6 The nerpa is a seal found only in which freshwater lake?7 Which royal family descends from". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
